news.text: I have been selected to present my research on a Design Pattern Builder in the ACM Student Research Competition at SPLASH in Amsterdam.

I supported the Demo of “BeCasso: Artistic Image Processing and Editing on Mobile Devices” at the SIGGRAPH Asia 2016 Symposium on Mobile Graphics and Interactive Applications. The demo received a Best Demo Award.
I fly to Buenos Aires to present our architectural styles for Android app product lines at the MOBILESoft, co-located with the International Conference on Software Engineering.
I won the ACM Student Research Competition at the ‹Programming› conference with a new concept for Continuous Code Reviews.
I have finished my bachelor thesis 'A Framework for Editing and Execution of Image and Video Processing Techniques on Mobile Devices'.

We published our Android app Pencil Hatching.
The current release is restricted to Germany, Australia, Canada, Sweden, and the Netherlands as well as devices that have at last 2 GB RAM, support OpenGL 3.1, and have at least Android 5 (Lollipop). Details of the project can be found here.
I presented our paper on ProsumerFX at the SIGGRAPH Asia Symposium on Mobile Graphics and Interactive Applications. The slides can be found here.
We won the best paper award at the SIGGRAPH Asia Symposium on Mobile Graphics and Interactive Applications for our paper ProsumerFX: Mobile Design of Image Stylization Components.
I have been admitted to the PhD in Software Engineering at CMU ISR. I look forward to working together with passionate and talented people.
Our education paper Teaching Image-Processing Programming for Mobile Devices: A Software Development Perspective has been published on Eurographics.
Our new concept on Cross-cutting Commentary has been published at the International Workshop on Context-Oriented Programming.
I started my PhD in Software Engineering at the Institute for Software Research at CMU.

Our vison paper "Trade-off-Oriented Development - Making Quality Attribute Trade-offs First-Class" has been accepted to ICSE NIER. Additionally, our paper on Attitudes, Beliefs, and Development Data Concerning Agile Software Development Practices been accepted to ICSE SEET.

I will present our paper "Trade-off-Oriented Development - Making Quality Attribute Trade-offs First-Class" at ICSE NIER on Friday in the session 16:00-17:20 in the Viger room. I look forward to interesting discussions about the concept. The slides will be uploaded after the presentation.
This fall I will be a TA for the class 'Models of Software Systems' at CMU.
This summer I will be doing a research internship at NASA JPL in Pasadena. I am very excited about getting to know new perspectives on software engineering research.
